since_last_update: Dominant driver crystallized: US equity risk-off tied to President Trump’s threat of new tariffs on eight European countries linked to the Greenland dispute; narrative broadened into a trade-policy/geopolitical risk-premium shock vs Europe/NATO (AP, Washington Post, MarketWatch).

Cross-asset “risk-off but not classic duration bid”: safe-haven demand lifted precious metals while US long-end yields rose (bond selloff) alongside equities, implying inflation/tariff-risk or term-premium repricing rather than growth-scare-only (MarketWatch, AP).
USD weakened materially alongside the risk-off impulse, consistent with a ‘Sell America’ framing rather than the usual flight-to-quality USD bid (MarketWatch, CNN).
Energy complex supported by weaker USD and geopolitics/trade-risk headlines; oil firm despite higher yields, suggesting headline-beta and FX channel dominated macro-rate drag (DTN).
today_focus: Primary session lens: trade-policy shock premium (tariffs on European allies) and whether it de-escalates/gets reframed as negotiating leverage; this is the key risk asset driver over conventional macro data sensitivity today (AP, Washington Post).

Watch the rates-equities correlation: rising long-end yields alongside equity selloff flags a potentially destabilizing mix (risk-off + higher discount rates), which is typically more punitive for duration-heavy Nasdaq leadership (MarketWatch, AP).

Safe-haven bid quality check: gold strength appears headline-driven (tariffs/geopolitics + USD down) rather than purely real-rate down; if yields continue rising, gold resilience would imply strong risk-premium demand (Reuters).
Oil: monitor whether FX weakness continues to support commodities or whether higher yields/global growth fears reassert; headline sensitivity elevated (DTN).

equities.inference: Markets are pricing a higher geopolitical/trade-policy risk premium and higher volatility, with a particular penalty to mega-cap/tech beta.
equities.evidence: Broad US index selloff with tech among hardest hit and volatility spike reported (AP, MarketWatch).

rates.inference: Curve repricing is not a clean growth-slowdown bid; instead it reflects higher term premium and/or tariff-linked inflation uncertainty and supply/positioning effects.
rates.evidence: Long-term Treasury yields rose on the same day as equities fell (AP, MarketWatch).

fx.inference: USD downside indicates the market is partially pricing US policy unpredictability as a confidence/flow headwind, not just global risk-off.
fx.evidence: ‘Sell America’ framing with dollar sliding alongside equities (MarketWatch, CNN).

gold.inference: Gold is pricing elevated tail-risk and policy uncertainty; safe-haven demand outweighs the headwind from higher yields (for now).
gold.evidence: Gold jumped to record highs on tariff threats and soured sentiment (Reuters, MarketWatch).

oil.inference: Oil is pricing a mix of geopolitical risk and USD support, temporarily dominating the higher-yield macro drag.
oil.evidence: Crude described as supported by dollar slide and Greenland/tariff-linked geopolitical risk (DTN).

risk_register.risk: Trade-policy escalation/retaliation cycle with Europe (tariffs, countermeasures, broader restrictions) extending risk-off and pressuring global growth expectations; also raises inflation uncertainty (tariff pass-through).
risk_register.timeframe: This week into February tariff start window

risk_register.risk: Adverse regime for equities if bond yields keep rising during equity drawdowns (tightening financial conditions + valuation compression), especially for duration-heavy sectors.
USD weakening alongside risk-off can amplify cross-asset volatility (EM/commodities/hedging flows) and complicate the typical hedging playbook.
Headline-driven gaps/liquidity air-pockets: policy/geopolitical tape bombs (tariff specifics, NATO/EU responses, Greenland developments) dominate systematic re-risking/de-risking.
risk_register.timeframe: Overnight and cash open/close windows through this week

risk_register.risk: Macro data catalyst risk: core PCE and labor data can reprice front-end expectations; if inflation surprises higher, it can reinforce the ‘bad mix’ of higher yields + weaker equities.

event_warnings: Jan 21: Pending Home Sales and other housing/activity prints—secondary unless they shift the rates narrative amid elevated tariff/geopolitical risk premium (ForexFactory).
Jan 21: President Trump speaks—high headline risk for tariffs/Greenland/EU response framing; can move equity risk premium, USD, and rates simultaneously (ForexFactory, AP/Washington Post context).
Jan 22: US Final GDP + Claims + Core PCE—cluster risk for rates repricing; core PCE is the highest sensitivity node for equity duration and USD in this week’s calendar (ForexFactory).
Jan 22–23: API/EIA-related energy inventory cadence—can add noise to oil on top of geopolitics/FX drivers (ForexFactory).
Jan 23: Flash PMIs + UoM sentiment/inflation expectations—can swing growth vs inflation balance; with policy uncertainty already elevated, reactions may be nonlinear (ForexFactory).
